description:
Away from Wimbledon, England will be the slightly happier of the two teams going into the second day of the first Ashes Test against Australia. The host were shamed on 343-7, Joe Root was a star of Day 1, striking 134, ably assisted by Gary Ballance and Ben Stokes who both made a half centuries. Pat Murphy was watching in Cardiff.

"A fluctuating day's play with the stirring fight back by England. They had a major slice, a lock on 43-3 when Joe Root was dropped second ball by Brad Haddin. But Root then played superbly I think, 153 with Gary Ballance before Ballance won for 61, but Root continued to play positively. He's 134 of 166 balls in an instinct of a player, bang on top of his game. Ben Stokes with 52, and Jos Buttler of the 27, also bristled with aggression, but the loss of both in the final hour tilted the balance back towards Australia."

England will be looking to push on past 400 later on Thursday, but what does Joe Root think will be a competitive first things title.
